reviews.review_msg: Frederick's online class is honestly pretty easy. Practice questions in the textbook will 100% show up on the tests, but this means the averages are REALLY high (1 had 90% ave). He does 8 "mini-tests" rather than a midterm and final. However, this means that there will be one almost every week along with homework, so there's a lot to do every week.

I took the course online so could change when in person, no midterm or final, 8 weekly quizzes worth 10% each and 20% for hw. The difficulty level fluctuates depending on the chapter. However, averages were pretty high (70%-90%). To succeed, go over the textbook and practice a lot, ask questions if you need to and you should be fine.

Fred is an extremely nice man and taught many things that were outside of the textbook but in my opinion were more useful. My one complaint is that he relied heavily on connect to the point that either the test questions were just the same as the practice questions or ones that no one has ever seen before, therefore being too difficult.
He is a caring man, makes finance sound like an everyday thing. Lots of homework so be prepared for that and a high curve.

Waste of time, energy & money. Frederick did not teach; he outsourced the marking to McGraw. No midterms or final exams, just weekly homework and mini-tests. The averages were astronomically high on these assignments as all answers were on Chegg. If you want to be rewarded for studying and not cheating then do NOT take this class with Frederick.
This dude is the goat. Sweetest and most caring mans.

He is a very nice teacher and helps you in understanding the concepts. The two gripes I have are his tangents that arent relevant (sometimes), and the tests were inconsistent in difficultly. The online class are set up pretty consistently. A minitest every week. If you study a day before you'll probably be fine. Go over the textbook questions.

He is a nice enough person but as an instructor, there are much better finance professors at SFU. I don't believe his background is in finance but it is in physics and philosophy. He covers a marginal amount of material in class and expects us to learn the rest on our own. It should be taught by someone else who has a background in finance.

In this course you basically teach yourself. All tests/hw are done through a third party website. You are required to complete HW before the lecture so you basically learn even before you attend the lecture. He probably goes over 2-3 concepts in lectures, rest teach yourself. Don't know why I'm paying $$$$ to teach myself!

Federick is a solid choice for a professor. BUS 312 is considered a difficult but he does a great job explaining lecture material and is always available for help. His grading scheme is generous, more specifically, a chunk of the marks were for completion at least when I took it.

Having taken BUS 312 with both Frederick and George Blazenko, I can say with absolute certainty that taking it with Frederick is easier. The grading scheme is designed to help students pass, and the information is more easily absorbed by breaking it down into smaller chunks covered over the assignments and lecture slides.
It was his first time teaching BUS312 and there were some mistakes but I'm sure he will be a strong instructor soon. He seems to be a very nice guy.

Very nice man knowledgeable on the topic. Lectures can be dry but keep an eye out for his insight and opinions. They're a gem to listen to. No textbook needed, a lot of practice questions provided. Practice exams nearly 1:1 to real thing. Practice the questions and you're gucci.
Really nice guy.  Go to him for help if you need it!

Yuriy's teaching style is very straightforward and clear, which I enjoyed. He doesn't waste your time and gets straight to the main points. His grading system is fair and allows you compensate your grade a bit if you bomb one of the quizzes or exams. BUS 312 is definitely a tough class with difficult tests, but I am glad I took it with Yuriy.
Andrew is awkward and unapproachable. Students also must get 50% on an arbitrary section of the final to pass the course regardless of how well they were doing otherwise.
Andrew will fail you if you don't pass the qualitative section of the exam.
Mr. Flostrand is an OK instructor but he is quite unapproachable and lack communication skills. I would avoid taking class from him.

Andrew did a great job for teaching for the first time. To do really well you must practice a lot and take the time to understand the material. All of the resources are given to you so you can succeed. All of the negative reviews are from people who didn't put in the effort to get a good mark. Andrew did his best and he did very well.

Considering this was Andrew's first time teaching this course, he did a respectable job. Had difficulty answering questions, but his lecture slides were an invaluable tool, which only he provides. To de well in this course, you NEED to practice. Be prepared to put in work. Start studying for exams at least two weeks prior and keep up to date.

Andrew thinks that he is a great prof but in reality he is not. He is very unprofessional and made a lot of fun of George (the other prof). Every lecture slides had 5-10 mistakes in it. He had no idea of what he was teaching. I am very surprised how he was chosen to teach this because he knew absolutely nothing. When questioned, he couldn't answer.

He will let you know directly how to do good in his class with all the material provided. He provides all of his past quizzes/midterms/finals on his website, open book/note, be prepare to practice hard and you will get what you deserve. Everything is given to you and the rest is up to you if you work hard. TAs are super helpful too

George is super smart but not so good at teaching. He rambles so much and on top of that he's got a grandpa voice that makes you want to fall asleep. However, he posts all his past exams on his website which was really helpful in studying. Aim for the highest grade u can get before the final to cushion the damage

Do the sample Midterm and Quiz. The sample is similar to the actual one. Cheating sheets are allowed. However, the final is really hard and it is totally different from the sample. Assignments are easy to get the mark. Try to get a higher mark as possible before the final.
Blazenko is an amazing prof. However, the material from the midterm to the final seemed a bit rushed. He is super funny.
Just work on past exams you will be ok. Solutions are accessible on homework. Dont need to go to classes since all lectures are recorded.

Blazenko is amazing. He gives you all of his past exams and quizzes, and there is no need to buy a textbook. For the midterm and quizzes, practicing old exams and quizzes is enough. Also, try to pace yourself for the exams, otherwise, you will not finish writing. Lastly, ask your TAs for help if needed, and do not fall behind!

George is the best prof I've had at SFU. He gives you every resource you need to be successful, and his passion for finance shows. There's might be easier profs out there, but if you're a finance major, definitely take this class with George as it will prepare you well for 315.
Amazing Prof who will go above and beyond if you go to office hours and show interest. I started a business later and he was willing to be part of the advising team to help us do well!
Live streams lectures and providers past tests for practice. Makes you work for it but youll learn a lot. Would recommend.

You really have to work hard and understand how to do the questions by practicing a lot. Sample quizzes & midterms were very similar to the actual ones. I got decently above average for both. The final was tougher but I did about 8 practice finals and ended up doing fine in the course. Just work hard and make good formula/cheat sheets for exams.

George is an extremely fair professor, as he provides ample practice material to prepare for quizzes and exams. Additionally, he provides step-by-step video solutions to homework and practice problems. This style of teaching rewards students who are willing to put the time and effort into the course. He is passionate about finance and it shows.

George is truly a nice guy that wants his students to succeed, he gives you everything you need to do well given you are willing to put in the work. You are NOT going to do well passively going through his class. I worked hard and studied endlessly and still found the course difficult. That being said, the average is typically below 65%.
On the plus side, you don't have to go to the lectures to pass the course. Just watch the videos. You will do well until you get to the finals. When that comes, good luck.
You can do well, if you put in a lot of work. A lot. Not recommended.

A riveting orator and a fascinating man. Blazenko's ability to inspire a class frequently reduces the students to tears of joy. A forewarning: you will discover parts of yourself that you never knew existed in this class. Be open to knew financial concepts, because George Blazenko will inevitably blow your mind.

George is a great prof who really sets his students up for success, provided they work hard. All his past tests are posted to study off and his weekly assignments ensure you keep up. Lectures are recorded and posted as well. If you keep on on material and practice (lots) you can do really well.

It's a tough class. George's lectures run dry but his notes from these lectures will appear on the qualitative portion of the final. Tons of resources / office hours for you to succeed, but does require consistent effort throughout the semester. MT and quizzes are standard. Final is quite tough. Practice practice practice.
Always repeat himslef unnecessarily. Assignments require knowledge ahead of lecture so you are basically forced to go see the TA. A little jumpy on the lecture, skip some steps.

George is a great guy to learn finance from. The earlier problems with his course being hard to follow have been mostly resolved by his new video examples. If you work hard you will have a clicking moment where the broad contents of the course come together. Midterm is time intensive - Get fast at samples. Final tests understanding over mechanics.

Tip: Try to do as many past quizzes/midterms as possible (he posts all of them online) and ace them. They're way easier than the final, and you need that cushion to save you from that horrible final exam.

Nice prof but extremely difficult. He is much much harder than Fred, assignments take hours, lectures give you headaches he repeats himself so often. I've taken CFA level 1 and his class is more difficult (and useless) IMO
Awesome professor. No need to buy textbooks. He will give you! I will take this professors' classes again.

This course is an introductory course for finance so it's not hard and it's probably the easiest one to get an A+ in beedie. His lecture is boring but solid, remember to do all his past practices and you'll be fine.
Not very helpful, rude, and lectures are basically word-for-word same as the textbook
miss class u'llbe done. 1 week missing means u've to work hard.

Professor Blazenko is so awesome. I loved this class with him because I really feel that I have learned a lot. He is approachable for help or just to chat casually. Great person and I am glad I was able to take Finance with him.

I really enjoyed Prof. Blazenko's class. His teaching style i boring at first but gets better. Although exams were difficult, especially the final exam, he gives you all the resources to succeed but its up to you whether or not you want to use them. If you have questions talk to him during office hours, he actually very friendly and very helpful.

The course itself covers A LOT of stuff and the lectures always go the full 2 hours. The lectures go at a fast pace but George does what he can to make the content as clear as possible. He does give you a lot of resources online to help you study, but the midterm and final are real tough.

I found his lectures extremely hard to get through. Theres so much material so dont fall behind. The final was (imo) so much harder than previous exams. Prepare lots for the final. It was crazy. TAs are super helpful so go to them! Just do every single practice he gives you, itll help you so much. The average is so high...

A bit lazy and uninterested in helping outside of class. Quizzes and midterm are fair but the final is MAGNITUDES more difficult. Exams are open book and he provides past samples, but even that won't help much for the final. He makes each one more difficult than the previous semester because of his own policies.

His lectures are sometimes confusing and hard to understand, so is his handwriting, but still, I would highly recommend you to not skip any lecture. His quizs and mid-term are easy and pretty much the same with the past exams samples he gave you before the exams. However, the final is a lot harder and is a bit different from the samples. Study Hard
good prof, knows his stuff but his lectures are tough to get through, material is challenging read it before hand so you can ask questions to claify

Never take bus 312 with him! His lectures are easy and pretty clear, but his exams are killing! Especially the final! Make sure to solve all of his samples quizes but do not expect them to be helpful 100%. Most likely he will take the beginning of the sample questions and then mix them to make them harder. Used logarithms to solve his final.

I had a wonderful learning experience in the semester of fall 2014. Professor Blazenko  is very inspirational and encouraged students a lot. Under his encouragement, I did very well on this course. I am preparing to apply his TA in the future semesters.

George is a good teacher I would recommend. He posts all of his past quizzes, midterms, and final exams on his course website. Exams are OPEN BOOKNOTES. My advice is PRACTICE;  do all of his most recent sample quizzesmidterms and final exams because his exams will be similar to that. STUDY HARD for the final because it is tricky.

This guy, and this class, is simply AWESOME! if you like finance, or are interested in finance, this class is definitely the class for you. He also provides every single test he's ever given to help you prepare for tests and quizzes (2 quizzes a Mid and a Final). This does not mean the class is easy, you have to work hard, but an A+ is possible!!!!

Smart prof, but his exams are very difficult. His notes not organized as you need to discover the many formulas by yourself from practice exams and he can always find a way to trick you. Class average is very high (half from retakes) comparing to its difficulty. I am usually above average in all my classes if I effort in, but not this class.

George is one my favorite profs at SFU. Seriously. If he's teaching a finance course that you need TAKE IT WITH HIM. There are no surprises on his exams and quizzes even though they are a bit tougher than the practice. This was one of the classes where I actually liked going to lectures (and we all know those are hard to come by)

If you have a poor attention span DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. Repeats things on average 7x we counted but at least things are clear. Open book exams. You will however have a high chance of falling asleep in lecture.
knowledgeable and funny prof! One of my favorite profs.Do as many quiz/exam samples as you can,and you will do well.

George is a nice guy & I like the way the class is structured. Like any math class; practice makes perfect. Upon reflection, the stuff taught is really interesting, it's just unfortunate that such a broad discipline is crammed into 13 weeks. Makes it hard to really understand the material cause you just spend your time doing a million calculations
Kept on repeating himself, had no respect to students, useless book, didnt explain why equations are the way they are, makes it hard to understand and to use.

I hate finance, but i study hard. MT got below average by ~12%, but probably aced my final and ended up with an A- (he will scale your grade up if your final percentage is 10% more than your mt percentage!!) Note: samples are way easier than the actual exams

His lectures can be very boring and most of the time you will class confused. The book did not do much for me because it's written in the same way as his lectures are structured. What got me an A+ in the course is by doing ALL of the sample questions he posted online.

You might not get used to his rather monotone voice at first, but he gets better and better throughout the course. He is quite an amusing prof and is very helpful during office hours. He provides lots of sample exams - do enough of them until you understand the patterns and then you can get a very good grade in this course.
This course is one of the hardest core courses ive ever taken! make sure u do well in midterm and assignment because the final is a killer! good overall

Dr. Blazenko is very nice, and very helpful if you see him in office hours. TAs are hit and miss, there was one really good TA that explained concepts clearly. This class is tough, try to do well on the midterm - you will probably fail the final. But everything's curved so just make sure to do well on everything else.

George is a genuinely nice guy but I feel that he begins his finance class at a level that is too difficult for an intro class. I think he does this simply because he's been teaching so long. He's pretty funny and gives tons of example exams for both the midterm and final so make sure you do them! Exams are open-book but still difficult.

Class is so do-able but don't fall behind. It's all open book, but just memorizing is often not enough. Make sure to understand the concepts. Blazenko is nice guy but moves very fast in class...don't buy textbook as he offers it free online. Overall, easy class but KEEP UP WITH WORK..final was brutal but its scaled
He is a good prof overall, clear and helpful. It'll be better if he can explain to us how to get those formulas rather than tell us to memorize them.
Excellent Prof! Easy A+
Great Prof! Very nice!

Terrible finance prof. Don't bother to buy the textbook because it makes no sense and it's the same as the notes he gives in class, plus he posts the notes online on the class website. Uses different equations and symbols than actually used in finance so if that's your concentration, don't take it with this guy.

Excellent prof. His notes are very helpful, and really complement the book he wrote himself. Do a lot of his sample tests, and you'll do fine on his exams. The book itself is excellent and should guide you through answering the samples. Overall, a very helpful course with reasonable difficulty.
Easy course if you do the samples

He is very nice if you go to his office or email him with any questions. His notes are well orgranized, though his handwriting is bad. He gives A LOT OF practices to help you understand the concept and his exams are straightforward as long as you do all the questions. Highly recommend! :)

This course is really easy...after MT, i hardly learned the materials at all. When I tried to do the sample finals, I even didn't know how to do most of the questions. But thanks George's sample finals and the solutions, I memorized and analyzed the last two ones deeply two days before the Final, finally I suprisingly ended this course with an A+.

Everyone tries to avoid taking 312 with George, and in the middle of the semester I even advised friends to try to take it with someone else if they could. But after reflecting on the semester, I realized that even though his exams are very tough, he's an amazing teacher and does a great job explaining himself. Tough exams? so what? IT'S CURVED!

he is the perfect prof for BUS312. well.. the course requires lots of work, but in general the class doesn't do so good so ur grade will go up if you do all the assignment ( DO NOT COPY the answer) the exams is exactly the same, so you will do well.

Horrible. Uses his own textbook that has typos and mistakes all over the place, and also doesn't explain the material well at all.  He even says he teaches his own formulas, not the ones financial planners actually use, ones from other textbooks.  In class examples easy, exams ridiculously difficult! DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS
great and competent Finance Professor

It's quite obvious that George is very passionate with what he teaches. He's a nice guy - even providing the text online so you don't really have to buy it. If you take his class, be sure to DO THE WORK. There are tons of assignments, but they're actually necessary for you to do well. He provides A LOT of sample quizzes and test - do them all!

Excellent Prof! the final exam was extremly difficult. However, his class will give a solid foundation to those who wants to major in finance. He gives real world application, I strongly recommand his class. But for those who think they will fly by without hardwork, then you are better off not taking his class.

"Utter regret in taking it with Stalin-I mean, Blazenko," are too light of words to describe how I feel. His lectures are annoying, he repeats things, lays out the dumbest examples like: A=2 and B=3, then A+B=?. Sitting was never so painful. Listening has never been so useless.
For your sake, take it with a different professor. You can have it so much easier on yourself.
Everything fell down to the final at which point he decided in the privacy of his office that he would screw everyone over.

I would not have gone into finance if he had not made it interesting for me.  Note: In the first class I think he tries to make his class as boring as possible so people will drop his always full class.
Quizzes and midterm weren't that hard, but final is pretty tricky. But if you do all the practice questions and his old exam questions, you will do fine in his class.

Blazenko is a good professor.  If you want to do well, sit in the front row, do all your assignments and do every question from the practice quizzes and exams...you should do fine if you follow that.  he does put some tricks in his questions, and some times there is an easy way and a hard way to solve questions, chap 6 is most difficult.
20-year's teaching experience. Examples are pretty old, but fundamental. If you do all the assignments and samples, you can get an A for sure.

Class is intense. Do the practice questions, and make sure you understand those, because the ones on his exams are way harder. He has "tricks" for each question. Each question is different.I found that his tricks confused me a lot and prevented me from really strengthening my foundation.

The exams were pretty hard compared to the samples. The final was very tough considering the time limit and the amount of thinking required. He has immense knowledge about finance, so take it with him if you really want to learn finance.

Pretty hard exams. Everything is open book, but if you compare to his old exams, the new ones are a lot harder. Boring lectures. He wrote his own textbook - the solutions can seem pretty random because a lot are not updated accordingly. Hard if you're not strong in math like me.
Best Prof ever.

His notes are good enough to explain the book, so you don't really need to read it since it's way lenthy anyways. Quizzes and midterm was easy, just do sample exam. Final I would say sucked because the ch 8 and 9 material he went over was limited. He examed us on more than he taught us. Practice questions for ch 8 and 9 were also not abundunt.

George is a good prof, he gives out very good notes. Exams are tricky though, you can solve the question very qucikly if you can see the "trick? he used otherwise you'll find yourself staring at the question and couldn't get anywhere! do a lot of pratice questions if you want to do well. By the way, anyone else find the final exam this term crazy?

He made easy material so much harder to understand. His lectures are so confusing. Quizzes/Exams are open book and the TA marks so easily but WHY so many people still can't do well? The worst part is...when people are confused about the lecture, they will read textbook. But he wrote his own textbook, which is....arghh...

Blazenko's experience clearly shines for this course.  He provides you with all the practice questions you'll ever need (though it's your own responsibility to do them) and gives interesting applications to concepts in lecture.  (btw, this course is an easy credit if you've taken ACMA 210 :p)

Best prof ever. So caring, so knowledgeable. Very thorough in delivery of course material. Always willing to help and clarify. Highly interested in material. Created course text and charged less than 25% of other Finance texts! Long live Dr. Blazenko!

Re-took class in Fall'08 w/ George instead of R.Z. Wow what a difference. George is completely by the book and explains everything very clearly. The key to doing well is understanding CH6 like the back of your hand. Study his examples, text Qs, and this samples. This is the ONLY way to do well. From D to A+, i'd say Blazenko is the way to go.

Highly recommended.This course is all about theory and calculation coz it is a introductory course of finance, so don't expect too much practical stuff. chapter 6 in the key element of the whole semester, you will be tested 3 times about this . figuring out how to adjust those formulas in chapter 6 before the midterm will get you a A for sure!!!

The fact that he wrote the textbook wasn't a good thing, as his in-class notes were usually just slight variations of what's in the text. He offers more detailed examples in class, but I would have liked to have had even more complex questions- showing us how to plug numbers into formulas doesn't help. Do TONS of past exam questions to do well!
He knows his stuff, and most importantly has even written the textbook.  His notes are sooo well organized, and even better he offers many many example exmas and quizes to help you out.

Blazenko is one of the better finance profs. Be warned, this class is NOT easy. However, George is a great teacher with great insight and experience. I would take him for all my finance courses, if I could!
horrible prf.  wrote the text himself which doesnt help you at all. exams are tough.
This class is tough once you get to chapter 6...practice, practice, practice...because it's all open book
This class is tough once you get to chapter 6...practice, practice, practice...because it's all open book

A very nice prof and thorough teacher; however, the course is tough for those that do not have strong math skills. You can succeed though, you just have to dedicate a lot of time to the class. George is awesome though. He invited me into his office just to have a chat about the course and gave me chocolate!

I hoped that this class would provide me with some practical analysis tools that I could use but got none. I found that the class was completely impractical. He talks non-stop and it is hard to keep up with him. The assignments and exams were open book, but very hard. The only way to do well is dedicate every spare minute doing the practice tests.

He is a nice guy but not a good teacher. He talks tooooooooooooo fast in class and never pauses. The exams are not hard cuz you do exactly same things as the samples and assignments, but the course material is boring... I got an A but I hate this course.

This has got to be the easiest Business course since BUEC 232.  Open book and notes for quizzes/exams means that all you have to do is do and understand the practice quizzes/exams.  Very clear explanations and notes.  The course itself is mostly quantitative so if you're good at math, you should be fine.

this course requires a lot of work. thats why its 4 credits. the assignments are relevant to the exams. he talks quite fast though. and his writing is pretty bad too.  he gives many practice questions. the assignments have answers and is only marked for effort.. that's a free 10% already

His exam, midterm and guizes are very simialr to samples and assignments. However, you won't be able to do well on them if you don't do alot of pracitce questions. He seems to know the material very well but he goes over it way too fast. He should realize that he's been teaching the same thing for so many semesters while it is totally new for us.

Very knowledgeable on his subject, however, he tends to go over his stuff too fast. I suggest that you do pre-read before going to his lecture. Exams are very straightforward. The trick to his open book test, is to come prepared by doing lots of practice and not to spend too much time looking for answers in the text.
He's too smart teaching an intro level course...sometimes he assumes everyone knows what he's talking about but in fact we don't. Nice prof tho, the questions are straight forward, no tricky BS.

Horrible prof. i was looking forward to this class but he ruined it. spends lecture going very quickly over the book (which he wrote). dont bother going to lecture b/c u wont learn nething since he goes over stuff too fast, just read the book at your own pace.  valuable lecture time spent on easy and useless stuff but hard stuff is barely covered.

this guy is horrendous, worst professor I've had in 5 years. He doesn't explain anything, his lectures, answers, material, and formulas are completely inconsistent, so he leads you different ways depending on if you use lec notes or his book. He won't use tutorials and office hours with the TA's are inefficient. boggles me he still teaches goZitron

This man LOVES to repeat himself and go over material way too fast.  Underneath it all, he is very knowlegable but it's really difficult to follow him in class.  Each lecture produces at least 3 or 4 double-sided pages of notes!  Just be sure to take notes dilligently and to carefully review all assignments and posted quiz/midterm material.

His a smart guy with lots of experience in teaching. However, he tends to go over things way too fast. You should pay attention all the time during the lecture because he writes on the overhead so fast and his notes are very unorganized.
he is good at teaching and knows his material well. however, u still have to do as many as problems from the text, sample midterm, quiz final as you can! cause thats the way you learn!

Take this course with any other prof but him. He is terrible. Constantly repeats himself, while explaining NOTHING..lectures are useless, pretty much have to teach yourself the material. No tutorials so the TA office hours are crowded and you can't get one on one help with anything. He makes the material much harder to learn than it actually is

Knows his material but does not know how to teach at all. All he does is regurgitate example after example, speeding through material like an auctioneer. When u ask him to slow down, he just looks at ur like ur retarded. First and only finance course I will ever take. Was looking fwd to it but cant see anyone wanting to major in finance after this
Great prof. He really teaches you something. Knows his stuffs well. Helpful sample tests.
Waited a year for his BUS 312.  It is worth it! Gonna wait another year for his bus413
Useful course with very very helpful practising quizzes. Numerical mistakes are not counted in exams and quizzes. Nice guy with a 'Bao Gong' face!!!
He is the best prof I've ever known.  However, still hope he could smile a little bit more; I was scared of asking him questions because of his poker face. :-)
EXCELENT NOTES
He knows his stuffs very well
No Comments
the course has nothing to do with finance its more algebra test
If you're weak in math, take Pavlov for 312. Nice guy, can't teach
May be a good teacher, but not for an intro finance class.
giving A's out like candies
Looked like Jim Carey, and you can't find anyone easier than this guy.
Way too easy...sometimes it's a bad thing
Does he understand the bell curve??
No Comments
nice guy, but not a very good teacher
No Comments
Make you look forward to going to his class
He makes everything very straight forward and has a good sense of humour. Wants his students to do well.

At first he would seem like a jerk but he is really a nice guy! He is helpful and wants his students to do well. He has that no student left behind policy :). He is a young fellow and explains concepts really well. Ya, the lectures were a bit boring but just read the book, pay attention in class and you would do just fine. i would do him ;-)

He comes off cold - however, he is actually a very nice guy. For instance, he brought Mars bars to the final exam for student in case they were hungry during the test. How many profs do that?? It seems as if he wants students to do well - on their own. Overall he is a good prof, and I would definitely take a class with him again.

Apathetic and unresponsive to students' concerns. Very unclear in providing instructions for assignments and exams. Lecture is a waste of time - he is always unprepared and spends a majority of the time scribbling all over his slides on his fancy tablet and talking about the iPhone and Scotiabank.
Good Prof. He wants students to understand what he is teaching.
Made Finance much more interesting and easy to follow than I expected.

The course content itself isn't hard but it's really easy to fall behind and do bad on the topic tests. I personally liked the course content but everything is self-teaching. Lectures you basically go to meet friends but learn nothing. Averages are also pretty higher than prev semesters, so before
Fully expect to teach yourself from the textbook. Terrible professor

shows up to class late, talks about her personal life way too much adds an extra hour to each lecture, lectures so simplistic and don't really help at all, no syllabus going into the third week of class..... just do your job pretty simple

Four tests and only highest three will count. Love this. Many office hours during the week to help us. Sometimes the tests have vague expressions, hope can be clearer for further students! Tara is very nice and caring for students. The only thing is she is not very responsible for Emails, so better to go office hours!

worst prof OF ALL TIME. i don't say that lightly. she has been kind to me in general but she would be better off working in a profession that doesn't involve time management or organization. i saw her a handful of times because she was straight up never in class, got TAs to teach the whole thing. exams were not relevant to course material.

Tara is extremely unorganized. We did not get a syllabus until the second week. She has tons of TAs that are just incompetent. TAs recorded solution videos that she posted on Canvas, but not only they're hard to understand, but their solutions are wrong. How can you be a TA when you can't solve problems yourself? 
This is just outrageous.

Tara is a bad communicator, very unorganized (her canvas page is the biggest mess), not accessible (will not answer your questions), does not show up to class (literally), has a very loud voice (some cannot stand it), marks the exams by the final answer (make a decimal mistake and youre screwed), gets her TAs to do everything, not good at teaching.
Just a heads-up in case you're considering her class. Find another class where the professor shows up, teaches, and emails back, and you don't need a crystal ball to predict the test schedule.

She never responds to emails, and most of the lectures are led by the TA. If you're into the whole "teach yourself the course" vibe, then maybe it's your thing. With the SFU strike going on, she decided to play around with the test schedule, first delaying them and then suddenly throwing weekly tests at us. It's like a rollercoaster of chaos.

I never disliked a professor as much as Tara, except one (Susan Bubra). Tara does not teach, nor show up to class. Instead, the TAs will solve problems for you which you had to learn to solve on your own anyways in the graded homework the previous week. Tara's voice sounds is unbearable, you will notice every student is saying the same thing.
If you want to see a professor throw a temper tantrum during an exam, this class is for you.

This is a very unprofessional professor. I am approaching the end of my degree and I've never experienced a prof like her. She says one thing and does another, has THE WORST communication skills, and makes students uncomfortable by lashing out inappropriately. For the sake of your sanity, mental health, and GPA, do not take this class with her.

I thought people were exaggerating until I took a course with her. She doesn't reply to emails and basically gets her TA's to do everything. Be prepared to self teach yourself throughout the semester. For tests, she does not give you partial marks, only gives marks if you get the final answer right. Avoid her at all costs.

Worst professor I had at SFU. Sounds aggressive when she speaks and does not provide clear communication about whether tests will happen or not. Doesn't teach and reads off lecture slides. Gets her TAs to teach and go over questions. Never showed up to class one day and never addressed why or apologized for wasting her student's time.

She was an hour late to class during the third week of school, no apologies nor explanation. Due to the strike with TSSU, no class was held. Unlike other professors who try to offer help to students, she only uploaded three five-minute videos onto canvas to replace a three-hour lecture. No information on classes and no replies on emails as well.

cant stand her voice, no one can. Most unorganized prof ive had, did not show up an entire class and everyone left, no excuse or reasoning given. We had to watch a recording on our own time to make up for that. She also doesn't even teach, the textbook does. She gets. her TAs to do practice problems and teach us instead. Easy course, not with her.

Content, difficulty and marking might be alright but I'd just drop the course for the annoying voice.

Very disorganized though.

I have never seen a more disorganized prof in my entire time with SFU. I had to swap out of her class in the first week, there is no way I'm paying that kind of money for her to show up late to class and not teach any meaningful course content. Do you seriously expect us to teach ourselves and then not answer our questions? Absolutely unacceptable.

She does biweekly quizzes which are fair if you studied except for a few chapters (it was so whack). She is disorganized, but it is understandable because she marks each quiz herself and remarks it if you have any concerns. It was an easy A because it was done online and it gives you more time to study since you don't have to attend class.

Tara is a nice lady. But she is the most unorganized prof I had ever seen. She ghosted your email and if you asked her questions she would let you to ask TAs. But many times even TAs were not sure. She taught super simply for lectures but bi-weekly tests were way more complex. Just DON'T choose her.

Taras course structure was good with bi-weekly quizzes worth 12.5% each. However she is EXTREMELY unorganized. Every quiz had some issues and many questions were marked wrong. You will have to spend hours in office hours trying to correct her and get the mark you deserve. I never thought it was possible for a prof to be so unorganized.

Tara is nice and her bi-weekly tests are fair. However, the lecture is useless as she teaches basics and tests from the textbook. The bi-weekly tests were only easy if you read the textbook and did the textbook questions for practice. She never replies to emails and there is always a grading issue on every test. She is super unorganized.

Great course structure (bi-weekly tests worth 12.5%). However, tests are full of issues. There's at least 1 "technical" issue in each test. She normally blames IT for these issues... but it's actually her own laziness. If you enjoy getting robbed grade points because of typos the prof makes, then you should pick her!
Not a well organized Prof. Only best thing is no midterm and final. But otherwise, take a better prof if want to learn something out of this course.

Tara is a nice lady but cant teach. She covers basics in class and tests you on things not even in the textbook. Tests are barely functional on Canvas. I forgot to round a few answers, she said not her problem. Bi weekly tests non cumulative some ppl like it, but offers no reason to learn from mistakes & no room for redemption
Get ready to read. She doesnt teach anything!!! Exams are riddled with issues...

This prof is so unclear with her instructions, I wonder how much time she actually invests in organizing this class. There is always something wrong with tests (e.g. missing questions). She ghosts you when you email her about anything. How is she getting a PhD in education. She is horrible at teaching you the right things. Test and assignment heavy

Bi-weekly tests (focuses on 2 chapters, non-cumulative) instead of a midterm and final, which is good. HOWEVER, she (and the TA's) never respond to emails on time. Her lectures cover the simplest lessons, and then she tests us on material 5x the difficulty. Doesn't post assignments or practice problems until one day before they're due.

Not accessible outside class and takes weeks to months to reply to your email and release grades. She literally goes to lecture to ramble on about the simplest things and then we get tested for something very complex. She warns us in the beginning that the slides aren't hers... yeah... we know, it's obvious. Bi-weekly tests.

Worst professor I have ever had at Beedie. I was thinking about concentrating in finance but she has ruined that for me in one semester. The first midterm average was 35% and second midterm average was 50%. If you're considering her DO NOT take it. If possible, just wait for another semester and get a better prof because you will not learn and cry
She isn't bad, I mean she is nice, she tries to help. The chapters we tried problem questions from were ok, but for me I can't get anything out of slides.
Slides are awful, unclear what is being taught. Tests unrelated to course material

She mumbles a lot, her writing is a bit hard to read, and she goes really fast through her lectures. Sometimes it's hard to grasp concepts as she goes too fast and her exams require you to know everything to do well. Exam averages are low as people are quite lost in the class sometimes.

Nice-ish lady but belittles dumb questions, skims everything difficult. Extremely unorganized, slide deck useless, hw assignments r way easier than exams. Class is mandatoryish to ask questions, not for lecture content. Accent really isn't bad, but a huge mumbler and time waster. Be very direct when you have questions/ choose a different prof.
She is a nice person and cares about students. However, she is extremely unorganized and has a lot of mumbling. She can't even solve the problem from her midterm. I would not recommend her.
Very confusing professor

Greta may speak too fast at times, and she does have somewhat accent, but its not too bad. Her class is easier than blazenkos cuz her averages are lower. for the quizzes and the midterm, just do the past ones and ull be fine. for the final, make sure you're paying attention throughout the classes, as some theory questions she discuses in class come

The class was very very confusing. She speaks way too fast and mumbles and asks the class if they understand, then doesn't think to reteach the concepts when everyone is obviously completely lost. The final was far harder than the assignments and you needed deeper knowledge of the material than she taught. Would not recommend this class to anyone.

Greta's class is brutal. Her accent isn't too bad, but she talks WAY too fast and mumbles and expects people to just get it. She's constantly making mistakes in her own work that students have to mention to her to fix. She doesn't teach you how the process of figuring out the question works, just gives you a bunch of equations. Final was very hard

No lecture notes posted, and the textbook is very difficult to read so attend class. He explains the material very well. The midterm and the final has one tough question but the prof lets you know which ch its gonna come from. He pulls some question from the textbook practice problems. Practice Practice Practice and you'll do alright.

No lecture slides and the exams were challenging. Try to understand the concepts and examples he taught in lectures. He is very nice in general. He will answer your questions after class. In addition, questions are always encouraged during class, he will repeat some difficult calculations several times to make sure you can understand. Good prof!
he doesn't know how to teach

He's a good teacher,  but very old fashioned. Wastes 30 min of class handing quizzes back one by one, instead of giving them to TAs. No slides, only lecture notes in his horrible handwriting, so pay attention to what he says, he likes to use acronyms without writing what they actually are. Nice guy overall, wouldn't take a class with him again tho.
Don't skip class because he does not provide lecture notes. Make sure you pay attention in class and take good notes, since you'll need them to study
Don't skip class because he does not provide lecture notes. Make sure you pay attention in class and take good notes, since you'll need them to study. Also do tons of practice questions.

Ron Zitron was extremely helpful and clear. The midterms and assignments mostly reflect what he discusses in class. As there is no textbooks for this class, it is a good idea to attend all lecture as you will need his notes for assignments. To do well, YOU HAVE TO DO A LOT OF PRACTICE QUESTIONS. Midterms, assignments, exercises etc.

One of the best prof. You don't need the textbook, only have to attend every class and take notes by yourself. Quizzes are super easy, but midterm and final are super difficult. However, this class is curved, so you will be fine if you do your best to be above the average :D

Ron is one of the best profs. He is very informative and helpful. The course is consist of 3 quizzes and 2 exams. He will tell you exactly what will be on the quiz, so make sure you understand the sample questions during the lecture. And it's super easy to get 100% in all the quizzes. However, exams are much harder. The average is only 46%.
HARDEST COURSE I HAVE EVER TAKEN! hard marker and the textbook was not helpful at all. Some of the things taught in lecture were different from what the textbook states.

Participation is mandatory for his class because there is no lecture slides, all you have to do is to copy his notes in class. Reading the textbook is very helpful for understanding his notes. The exam is based on his notes in class

I wish he had lecture slides or recorded the lectures. This class is not designed very well, so I am not sure if it was him or the course or the textbook that made it so challenging. Do extra problems andvisit the TA often, and properly do all the assignments. I wouldn't recommend taking the class with him as he doesn't explain basic content.

He is a very nice guy. Everything is based on lecture notes, so it's absolutely necessary to attend. Try recording his lectures as backup, it will help. Exams and quizzes are very similar to the sample ones he posts. Best 312 prof Cool accent
Too difficult to be in 300 level >< you are expected too much and even the textbook doesn't help you much.

Ron is a nice guy. The course itself is hard so you really have to work if you want a good grade. The exam questions are tough, but if you attempt at answering the questions (and know what you're saying) then you'll end up with a decent mark in the class.

If you pay attention in class and cognitively follow along as he explains things on the board, it will save you a lot of pain and time. Don't need the text. It is a challenging course but he somehow makes it relatively enjoyable. Overall, he is a very articulate prof and the quizzes/exams have NO surprises. Don't miss a lecture.

Ron's a great lecturer and an overall nice guy. He even came in on a holiday for his office hours. Lectures are mandatory because he does all the notes on the whiteboard and the textbook is crap. It's not an easy course, and definitely requires a lot of work.

Less than one hour into class he started packing up and leaving.."I'm not lecturing under these circumstances." Ragequitted. To hand back quizzes, he calls people's name one by one...takes 40 mins of class time to get through the stack...smart.Why can't he just lay the papers out alphabetical order and have everyone grab their own. No PHD for that.

Doesn't use PowerPoint, only writes examples on the whiteboard. Most of the material is spoken, so quick note taking is essential. If you take good notes, you won't need the textbook at all; he covers the material very well. Exams are difficult with 50-60% mean. He posts example solutions in Excel, which is really helpful for working out equations.

This is a hard course, and Ron is a great prof for it in my opinion. Read the textbook, do the assignments and RECORD HIS LECTURES AND LISTEN AGAIN!!! There are no tricks here if you do all that then you are guaranteed to do better than the avg (B-). It is very easy to blame him for your failure since he doesn't have ppt slides n blah blah blah

One of the hardest courses I've taken.  He doesn't use any kind of slides or formal notes - you just have to attempt to copy down everything that he says and hope that you catch all of it and that it all makes sense. Doesn't have enough office hours and his exams are extremely difficult.

Ron is awesome.  I took 312 with Ron and I am currently taking 314 with him IN THE SUMMER, the only reason I'm taking it is because Ron is teaching it.  He is a great teacher, clear and open to questions in lecture and doesn't waste your time.  Exams are hard but just make a good cheat sheet and it will be fine.

Ron is a nice guy, BUT NOT  EASY. This course is really hard. Text is useless and Ron does not make himself available outside class very easily. This course should have tutorials since he never goes the full four hours and the material is difficult to comprehend.Take good notes and study really hard. TA was only available after class once a week.

Great prof. Great teaching style. Very clear. Bus 312 is a hard course, but Ron explains things well. I would recommend taking it with him. Assignments and exams are fair. Attempt the assignments and practice with the questions in the textbook and you should do fine.

very good prof.i enjoy his class every much.ive taken finance with him in summer session,starting 830 in the morning @surrey campus,i hav never skip any of the classes.his teaching is so clear, and after taking with him, i became so interested in Finance:)
Great finance prof. Love the sweaters. Makes finance interesting (not sure how). Accent makes me feel like I'm on vacation. Crystal clear teaching.

Zitron's easily one of the best professors in business. His lectures are clear and informative and after finishing the course you actually feel like you've learned something. Make an awesome cheat sheet and you'll be fine for the midterm and quizzes, although the final's quite tough and will test your  knowledge of concepts.
boring class
funny prof, loves to joke around. extremely helpful when needed. from south africa and loves to wear shorts!
He is one of my favorite prof at SFU, excellent lecture and very helpful. But exams are difficult.

312/336   This guy gets a green face???  That does not do Ron justice.  If you have an above average intellect (which you do), and you're willing actually work hard to get the material, to challenge yourself, taking his class will be a very rewarding experience.  Ron reminded me that learning CAN still be enjoyable.

Awesome teacher and nice too. I remembered three different ppl asked him the same questions in class...one after another... it's like they didn't listen what happend 2 minutes earlier. BUT he still answered them nicely... except on the third time, he nicely mentioned it would be on the final and perhaps they should keep it in mind.
Tests are short (6 questions), but quite challenging. He is a good lecturer and let us out an hour early on average (4 hour lecture). The work load is on the low side which is good.

Great prof!very clear lecturing and very responsive. He talks about all kinds of pratical questions and stimulate my interest in Finance.  Exams are hard, but curving is always a fair play, and he gives you effort marks.  A wonderful prof for students who like finance and who is willing to work hard on it.
good prof, lectures very clear. encourages questions, makes the class interesting.
Excellent prof. Lectures are well paced (doesn't pack everything at the end of the course). Has good discussions going in class, and is very responsive to students.

if u r interested in finance, he's ur guy. otherwise, take it w/some1 else! exams r hard, but avg is high for midterm, but ok for quizzes and low for final (cuz it's a killer!) ok guy but horrible textbook (he uses a photocopy as a text)! havin no proper text/tutorials, it's a tuff class, unless u understand him.
Tough class. Due to the lack of tutorials, you're kind of on your own. The key to doing well is to go to every lecture, take good notes, and practice the examples in the assignments and textbook.

One of the better profs I've had up at SFU. Clear explanations. Great use of examples. Actually kinda funny. Also, he speaks english, which is more than what can be said for most profs. Other than the occasional lateness, not much to complain about at all.
No Comments
His exams are super hard. But dun worry, since the class average is very low, u won't fail ur course. Be expected to fail every single quizzes though.
This class was HARD. You have to pay close attention, and work very hard. If you do you will get a great mark because most students won't put in the effort. He is easy to follow in lectures.
killer class...hes good...not great...nice guy though
Very good lecturer...but the exams are very very tough
Very hard exams but good prof. Approachable in office hours.
He can't teach.
Extremely hard exams. Take 312 with Pavlov if possible

Absolutely the worst professor I have had. He now teaches at The Interdisciplinary Centre in Hertzeliya. Terrible attitude with his students, his exam is marked extremely tough without any feedback and he makes the material way harder than it should be. I feel sorry if you have to take his class

DEFINITELY NOT TAKE THIS COURSE WITH HIM! although it looks great that there is no final, the workload is heavy! the team project is hard and very confusing for a third year business student. Moreover he always makes some easy concepts extremely hard to understand. If you have to take this course with him, then good luck!

No final exam, only 2 midterms and 1 project. The project is extremly confused for those who couldn't deeply understand finance. I will not recommend this prof for those who are not interested in accounting or finance.

His class is not fun or exciting. The examples are helpful, but this prof likes to make concepts seem more complicated than they really are. Reading the textbook is an easier exercise than attending lecture to produce the same end results. I attended lecture anyways for example questions. The assignments are relatively easy if you read the book.
Great prof, lectures are exciting and fun. He really tries to engage students and challenge them!  Highly recommend.

The best thing that I found about Amir was that he went through a lot of examples in class so that was very helpful. He is a much easier prof for this course than some of the other insturctors that teach it. You learn a lot and he prepares you for Bus315. Lectures are a bit dull but what else do you expect its finance.

Nice person, tries to help but confuses you even more. Told me to not go to him for help but to go to my TA instead (who told us not to e-mail for help and was never there).
 
 The class was boring, confusing, and irrelevant to what was tested on the exams. 
 I showed our class project question to ppl who I know have taken and aced several finance

This class was fine overall.  The way the prof explains and goes through problems step-by-step is really good.  Some lectures are boring.  He will not consider changing the weighting on midterms/project if you do badly on one, so don't even try.  No final!

Fairly nice guy, but one of the hardest prof for this course. My frds who took this with other profs had way easier material. Likes to explain a lot of things, which is good, but makes things more confusing. Overall, nice person, but I prob won't take courses with him unless I have to.

Maybe not the most approachable guy, but doing all of his assignment questions and his practice exams will more than prepare you for his exams (provided you understand them in and out). not an easy class, but on the difficult parts he spends alot of time doing practice questions in class.

It's hard to follow him in class but I appreciate him showing the class how to calculate problems step by step. Exams are easy if you do the readings, assignments, and sample exams. Yeah, the final is harder than the midterm but it's doable. At least the class average will drop (may work for you).

I thought he was a good prof. His grammar and spelling are pretty bad and his accent can be hard to understand sometimes, but he's funny and really interested in Finance. Does his best to explain things so everyone understands and will explain several different ways if needed. Midterm is really easy. Final fairly easy if you do the practice finals.

horrible class. horrible exams. horrible tutorials that are very useless. wish they were be more productive and a learning tool. this prof isn't very clear and makes mistakes during lectures that as students are expected not to make during exams so why is he teaching and we're not getting a slight break on exams eh!! hmmm
MT is okay. Final is extremely horrible! You never expected such ques on the final! jus sitting there and dunno wut to write.

very helpful lec.He explains better than the textbk if u pay close attention in class.I like him covering the most difficult parts in class,rather than explaining theories that we can read on our own. Ex. in class r related to hwk, so u hv ex. to follow. Not a nice person but duz well in teaching.

One of the worst Profs i've had.  Unclear, and hard to read his notes or understand him.  Talking to him outside of class does no good.  Notes are not enough, you must know the text inside and out. There were algebra questions on the final. He'll ask Q's you've never covered before in class or Tute.

Not a very good lecturer; uninteresting, and makes constant spelling and grammatical errors. MT is easy - it is crucial to do well on it b/c the Final is hard and will bring your marks down. His notes are not enough, u have to know the textbook and understand all the hmwk to do well in this course.
he is very helpful. understanding his notes and assignmnets are vrey helpful for this course.final exam is hard but reasonable.you can easily get an B as long as you do the work.
He is actually a very good prof.  Some people didn't read the assigned chapter(s) and expected to understand everything covered in the lectures.
Tests are very hard!!  Also, he's not clear at what he wants.  One day, no assignment needs to be handed in.  The day before the due date, suddenly it needs to be handed in for grading!!

This guy thinks everything in Finance is common sense!--so he doesn't offer help, he writes every single word he said in class. This prof. is super subjective. If he doesn't like your class, it's the end of the world! He will give you super difficult exams!
whether u understand or not is ur matter, not his matter. He is clear, fair. Just that everyone else will do well, and u will be curved down ><

This is simply the worst teacher ever. I don't have a single good thing to say about him. Bad grammar, bad notes, bad english, bad exams, bad clarity. He's even offensive at times. I don't understand how he got to teach at a University.
notes are fine. exam is fine. just****ty with the bell curve cause everyone else does so well.
he is easy and clear. only taking notes, then you can do the exams well. why he wants to copy notes on the lecture is a question but not a matter.

Sure he makes you write out notes.  I don't understand how people can say he's hard.  Im a C student, but I found this course to be very easy.  His exams are very simple and in office hours he's a great help.  He sincerely cares if you do well.
His notes are ridculous.
this prof is @$$. He doesn't know how to teach. His notes are full of grammar mistakes and spelling mistakes. I didn't attend his lecture and still got A. Just read the text book, cuz he can't teach
This prof wants you to build strong fundamentals.If you don't like him, go back to Douglas College.
I didn't like his note taking method...it seemed counterproductive to have to re-write all the notes that he had already typed out.
A new teacher with terrible teaching skills. A lot of in-class notes to copy down, but they not very helpful.
exams are not easy. notes aren't very useful, as will be spending all class copying notes. be prepared to copy 5-8 pages each class.

this guy doesnt know how to teach. he just read off his notes. his exams are so long; u r lucky if u can finish it. oh, his grammar is worse than mine. and he only has one hour (office hour) per week.
he not good...tests so hard...don't understand he
Sounds exactly like Big Bird, just shut your eyes and you can picture it.  Not a good prof, very unhelpful and never available.  Does not seem to care about students at all.
Good professor.  Lectures can be a little slow at times, but he does a good job explaining core concepts.  PS- His exams are EEEEASY!!
He teaches you math, but not how to apply it (or to think)
Not recommended
He cares about the students and he explains the topics very well

I thought that Vincenti was a great professor. He gave very clear guidelines for the course and straightforwardly explained everything. I would suggest reading the textbook chapters before class and using his lectures to clarify any confusion. If you read the text and do all the practice problems you can easily do well in his class.

nice guy for the most part. accent makes it hard to understand, and the material is dry. quizzes are a joke, as approx 30% of the class cheats every week. told prof, and he said "if we saw someone cheating we'd take action". pretty garbage class, marked on barely anything, few opportunities to learn/practice.

He is super caring and wants his students to succeed. He is open to answer any questions students have about the content. 25% for each of the two midterms and 50% for the final. All exams were super fair and heavily reflected his problem sets, lectures, and mock exams. Attending the lectures and doing all his provided practice is enough to succeed.

Great prof. cares for his students, always available to help and answers emails quickly. exams are hard but fair despite being worth 100% of your grade. do the homework and pay attention and you'll do fine.

Gherardo was not too bad; he cared for his students. You were only examinable by two midterms worth 25 percent and 50 percent on the final, and could skip the midterm to convert the weight to the final. His lectures were easy to zone out as it could become quite dry and his exam was way harder than the practice.
I enjoyed his teaching style, and by attending each lecture, I could fully understand the concepts.

Gherardo mostly lectures from slides and tries to engage students, but participation is low so it's easy to zone-out. Slides are concise and contain enough information to study on your own, but sometimes have typos. Problem sets are helpful, but exams are harder than the practice. He is very kind and genuinely wants to see students succeed.

Took in winter term. Fantastic guy. He genuinely wants to see you do well. IF YOU EVER HAVE A QUESTION IN CLASS DONT BE AFRAID TO ASK! 

If you can get over the 30/70 mt/final or 100 final grade scheme, he is good.

I'd vouch for him and genuinely wish him the best.

Loved 312 with Gherardo-- everything was very straightforward and organized. His slides were helpful, explanations very clear, and tests were fair. He genuinely cares about students. 
Prepare yourself for tests with many practice questions -- the test questions are similar to the practice, but at a higher difficulty. Final has very complicated NPV!

His accent is a bit hard to understand. I love that there's no homework, group projects, textbook, or mandatory attendance. How you do is up to you. But I suggest going to the lectures and practicing. He answers questions and genuinely wants the class to understand. You can't use a financial calculator for exams so prepare for that.

Gherardo is a fantastic lecturer. If you went to class, he was clear about what would be on the tests. He showed genuine concern for his students and allocated additional time for office hours if necessary. He has been one of the best professors I have had so far!

first Beedie professor that seems interested and invested in what they are talking about! so receptive to what students want out of the class and all the content in the class is highly relevant. If you study and attend lecture it shouldn't be difficult to score above the curve.
